thread.title: Nigeria's Buhari returns home after seeing doctor in Britain

title: Nigeria's Buhari returns home after seeing doctor in Britain
text:
May 11, 2018 / 7:01 PM / in 34 minutes Nigeria's Buhari returns home after seeing doctor in Britain Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
ABUJA (Reuters) - Nigeria’s President Muhammadu Buhari returned home on Friday after traveling to Britain this week to see his doctor, his spokesman said. FILE PHOTO: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari addresses the 72nd United Nations General Assembly at U.N. headquarters in New York, U.S., September 19, 2017. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton/File Photo
The 75-year-old president spent five months of last year in London on medical leave for an undisclosed ailment. His office said on Monday that his doctor had requested to see Buhari and the president would return home on Saturday.
“President Buhari just returned,” his spokesman, Garba Shehu said in a tweet.
Shehu said earlier in the week it would be a “routine check-up”.
However, the surprise announcement that Buhari would travel to see his doctor renewed concerns about his health weeks after he said he would seek re-election in a poll to be held in February next year.
Buhari’s critics say he is too ill to be at the helm of one of the continent’s biggest economies. Reporting by Alexis Akwagyiram; Editing by Alison Williams
